meanings.definition: A person who samples food or drinks.
meanings.sent1: The samplers at the food festival tried all the different dishes.
meanings.sent2: The samplers at the party enjoyed tasting the new cocktails.
meanings.sent3: The samplers at the picnic were the first to try the mystery punch.
meanings.sent4: She was like a detective, the samplers carefully examining each flavor for clues.
meanings.sent5: The samplers were like treasure hunters seeking the best flavors in the buffet.

meanings.definition: A piece of cloth embroidered with various designs.
meanings.sent1: The colorful sampler hung proudly on the wall of the living room.
meanings.sent2: She carefully stitched her name on the sampler she made in class.
meanings.sent3: The sampler looked like a rainbow with all the different colored threads.
meanings.sent4: Her sampler was a garden of flowers blooming in thread and fabric.
meanings.sent5: The sampler was a masterpiece of tiny stitches creating a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: A device used to collect and analyze samples of data.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used the sampler to gather information from the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The sampler beeped as it collected data from the environment.
meanings.sent3: The sampler hummed like a little robot as it scanned the samples.
meanings.sent4: The sampler was a silent observer, gathering data without bias.
meanings.sent5: The sampler was a digital detective, uncovering hidden patterns in the data.
